data.description: Discussion of major twentieth-century literary texts from Germany, Switzerland, and Austria by such authors as Franz Kafka, Bertolt Brecht, Anna Seghers, Friedrich Durrenmatt, Gunter Grass, Christa Wolf. Possible areas of emphasis: identity formation; technology and culture; literary representations of fascism.
data.title: TOPICS IN TWENTIETH-CENTURY GERMAN LITERATURE (IN TRANSLATION)
